byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

abstract: DealBook Online; software firm Citrix Systems says chief executive Mark Templeton will retire, and gives activist hedge fund Elliott Management seat on board; second quarter income doubles to $103.3 million on revenue of $796.8 million.
lead_paragraph: The software company will also offer the activist hedge fund a seat on the board and it will explore the sale or spinoff of its GoTo products.

headline.main: Citrix Will Replace Chief, Bending to Elliott Management

snippet: The software company will also offer the activist hedge fund a seat on the board and it will explore the sale or spinoff of its GoTo products.
